item.title: BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major Invites Revealed After Latest Valve Ranking
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/blast-tv-austin-cs2-major-invites-revealed-after-latest-valve-ranking/

The latest monthly Valve Regional Standings update has arrived, determining which Counter-Strike 2 teams receive an invite to the upcoming BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major. The rankings released today determine which teams will receive direct invites to either Stage 3 or Stage 2, and which teams will compete in the Major Regional Qualifiers to determine who competes in Stage 1.

After months of work, the teams that have guaranteed a spot in the Major already can also guarantees themselves a cut of the lucrative sticker money.

All CS2 Teams Invited to the BLAST.tv Austin Major

16 teams have been invited directly to the BLAST.tv Austin Major, via earning a high enough placement in their respective regional standings. Eight teams will start in Stage 3, meaning they skip the first two Swiss system stages, and eight will start in Stage 2, meaning they only skip the first Swiss stage.

Here are the teams that have been invited, and the region they are representing.

Stage 3

  • Team Vitality (Europe)
  • Team Spirit (Europe)
  • Natus Vincere (Europe)
  • MOUZ (Europe)
  • Aurora (Europe)
  • G2 Esports (Europe)
  • Team Liquid (Americas)
  • The MongolZ (Asia-Pacific)

Stage 2

  • Falcons (Europe)
  • FaZe (Europe)
  • 3DMAX (Europe)
  • Virtus.pro (Europe)
  • paiN Gaming (Americas)
  • FURIA (Americas)
  • MIBR (Americas)
  • M80 (Americas)

Major Regional Qualifiers (MRQ)

The Major Regional Qualifiers are six qualifier tournaments that will determine the 16 teams that will qualify for Stage 1 of the Major.

Here is the distribution of teams that will qualify for Stage 1 via the MRQs, and the teams that will compete in each region’s MRQ.

  • Six teams from Europe:
    • Astralis, SAW, HEROIC, 500, OG, BetBoom, PARIVISION, ENCE, GamerLegion, BC.Game, BIG, B8, Nemiga, Fnatic, 9 Pandas, Metizport
  • Three from South America:
    • Imperial, Legacy, ODDIK, RED Canids, Fluxo, Sharks, BESTIA, Solid
  • Three from North America:
    • Complexity, NRG, Getting Info, Nouns, Wildcard, BLUEJAYS, Marsborne, MIGHT
  • Two from China:
    • Rare Atom, Lynn Vision, TYLOO, DogEvil
  • One from Oceania:
    • SemperFi, ex-Talon, FlyQuest, Rooster
  • One from Asia:
    • The Huns, ATOX, Chinggis Warriors, Eruptions

It’s worth noting that this list of teams receiving BLAST Austin CS2 Major invites are based solely on the rankings released today, and that the official invites are subject to change. The Major Regional Qualifiers will begin in less than two weeks, running from April 14th to 17th.

For more Insider Gaming esports coverage, check out the latest on the Dota 2 International 2025 schedule.

item.title: Best Kilo 141 Meta Warzone Verdansk Loadout For Call of Duty in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-kilo-141-meta-warzone-verdansk-loadout-for-call-of-duty-in-2025/

Warzone Season 3 marks the long-awaited return of the Kilo 141 to cause chaos in Verdansk. Our Loadout will make the iconic AR dominate just as much as it did back in 2021.

Longtime series veterans will feel right at home on Verdansk in Season 3. The CR-56 AMAX, HDR, Grau, and Kilo 141 are all back, giving players access to the four weapons that initially reigned supreme on the map.

In addition, Verdansk has a fresh coat of paint, as Raven Software improved the beloved map with enhanced visuals, lighting, and new textures. As players return and try to determine which AR is the best in Season 3, the Kilo 141 stands out as a clear contender.

Thanks to TrueGameData, The AK-74 and CR-56 AMAX have the two fastest time-to-kill speeds among long-range meta weapons. In saying that, the Kilo 141 isn’t too far behind, and the AR is easier to control due to its forgiving recoil pattern and steady fire rate.

Although you won’t get the same damage output from the Kilo 141 as with the CR-56 AMAX or AK-74, the reliable AR has a faster fire rate and bullet velocity than other top choices and shines even brighter with this set of attachments.

  • Optic: Willis 3X
  • Muzzle: Monolithic Suppressor
  • Barrel: Reinforced Barrel
  • UnderBarrel: Vertical Foregrip
  • Magazine: Extended Mag II

Since the Kilo 141 is better suited for medium and long-range engagements, the best sidekick for this AR is an SMG to support short-range gunfights between 0 and 10 meters.

After having its maximum, medium, and minimum damage ranges buffed in Season 3 and its upper torso damage multiplier, the Kompakt 92 has the fastest time-to-kill of 550 milliseconds up to 13 meters away. A difficult-to-reign-in recoil pattern means using this SMG requires significant skill, but it’s lethal in the right hands.

  • Optic: Volzhskiy Reflex
  • Muzzle: Compensator
  • Barrel: Reinforced Barrel
  • Underbarrel: Vertical Foregrip
  • Stock: Infiltrator Stockn

Scavenger, Tracker, and Alertness are the best trio of Perks in Season 3. 

  • Perk 1: Scavenger (Start equipped with maximum reserve ammo for your primary weapon. Resupply ammo equipment and plates from dead enemies) 
  • Perk 2: Tracker (See enemy footsteps. Bullets you fire briefly outline an enemy for you and your squad)
  • Perk 3: Alertness (Sense enemies when enemies are nearby. Tell when you are being aimed at by the enemy) 

Since armor plates are so hard to come by, Scavenger is a must-use Perk for every loadout because you can get more armor off dead enemies. 

Meanwhile, losing enemies while chasing after them on Verdansk is easy, so Tracker allows you to see their recent footsteps. Also, hitting an enemy further away increases the time they are outlined. And even though Raven Software added new objects on the map to provide cover in open areas, there is always the danger of getting taken out by a one-shot sniper or an enemy with better positioning than you. Alertness alleviates this issue by pinging your screen when someone sees you.

Overkill is the best Wildcard to use. In Season 3, Raven Software removed the ability to purchase loadout weapons from the Buy Station. As a result, the only way to acquire loadout weapons is through loadout drops.

So, while having three extra attachments on a weapon with the Gunfighter Wildcard would be nice, we recommend using Overkill to give you a second primary weapon because acquiring one will otherwise be difficult.

How to unlock Kilo 141 in Warzone

The Kilo 141 is a reward in Warzone’s return to Verdansk event, meaning all you have to do is log in to the battle royale to unlock the AR instantly.


Before jumping into a match, check out our guide on unlocking the Thermite Lethal and Monolithic Suppressor to complete your Warzone loadout. Also, Try Warzone Casual as a practice run. And if you enjoy this class setup or have a different opinion about the best long-range meta weapon in Season 3, leave feedback in the Insider Gaming Forum.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows First Major Patch Drops Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/assassins-creed-shadows-first-major-patch-drops-tomorrow/

Assassin’s Creed Shadows Title Update 1.0.2 will be released on April 8 across all platforms. It will bring improvements, bug fixes, and more. 

Assassin’s Creed Shadows Title Update 1.0.2

The Assassin’s Creed Shadows development team has been working on this first batch of improvements since launch, and the changes in this update have been inspired by player feedback. Title update 1.0.2 for AC Shadows features several highlights, including selling and dismantling multiple items, the ability to reset mastery nodes, horse improvements, an Investigation Board shortcut and PS5 Pro enhancements. Check out all the new improvements and changes in the Assassin’s Creed Shadows Title Update 1.0.2 below: 

Horse Improvements

The first significant improvement from tomorrow’s AC Shadows update features changes towards the horse. Players can activate the pathfinder to enable Auto-Follow, and the horse will automatically follow the road to the destination. Also, horses are now quicker in cities, so players can glide through these areas much faster. 

Mastery Nodes Reset

Many fans will appreciate this change as it lets them fine-tune their builds according to their preferred play styles. Players can now reset Mastery Nodes for both Yasuke and Naoe, allowing you to test different play styles before finding what suits you the best. It also lets you explore all the game has to offer gameplay-wise. 

Selling and Dismantling Multiple Items

This is an exciting update for players who have been hoarding resources during exploration. It will allow them to manage and utilize their surplus items efficiently. The new update will add an option to tag and sell/dismantle multiple items in shops or while dismantling gear at the Forge. 

Investigation Board Shortcut

One of the features of the new update will let you reach the investigation board faster than ever before. After the update is released, you only need to hold the ‘Options’ button for a few seconds to teleport to the Investigation Board. A single press will still let you open the inventory. 

PS5 Pro Improvements for AC Shadows

Assassin’s Creed Shadows has received dedicated PS5 Pro improvements in Title Update 1.0.2. Firstly, PSSR support has been added, and players playing before the upcoming update must manually enable this mode through video settings. Also, the balanced mode will feature ‘Raytraced Specular,’ providing visual fidelity close to PS5 Pro Quality mode. 

Other Improvements in New AC Shadows Update

The upcoming update includes some miscellaneous improvements across the game; you can check them in the list below. 

  • The Hideout framerate has been uncapped to above 30 fps in Performance Mode.
  • Boss fights have received improved balancing.
  • An issue where the pathfinder line appeared in photos taken in Photomode has been fixed.
  • Inconsistencies with the ‘Throw a Kunai at the closest enemy after an assassination’ perk when ‘The Tool Master Gear’ is equipped on Naoe have been fixed. 
  • Double Assassinations have been improved. 
  • Naoe’s responsiveness, in some instances, has been improved.

Interested players can check out all the AC Shadows Title Update 1.0.2 bug fixes here. In other news, Assassin’s Creed Shadows is one of 2025’s best-selling games, surpassing 3 million players in 7 days. What are your thoughts on Assassin’s Creed Shadow’s first major update? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the accidental spoiler for Donkey Kong Bananza. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Ubisoft Stock Prices Falls To 12-Year Low Amid Company Uncertainty
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ubisoft-stock-prices-falls-to-12-year-low-amid-company-uncertainty/

Ubisoft’s stock prices have continued to fall, hitting a 12-year low on both the Paris Stock Exchange and London Stock Exchange. As of the markets closing in the region, Ubisoft stock is trading under €9 for the first time since April 2013.

As of publishing, the stock is sitting at €8.80 after falling another 7.83% on Monday. At one point it sat at €8.27 before it rose back to the closing number.

The reasons for the continued drop of Ubisoft’s stock prices should be surprising to anyone who has followed the company over the years. Since April 2024, Ubisoft’s shares have fallen 62.9% from its 52-week high of €23.70 to the €8.80 it currently sits. The company’s shares fell under €10 back in late October 2024 when it was announced that Assassin’s Creed Shadows would be delayed to 2025. However, it rebounded slightly back to over €14 per share not long after.

Fast forward to late March and early April, the company’s prices continued to gradually drop again. The big drop came, however, after Ubisoft announced it had reached a deal with Tencent on a new subsidiary that would include the publisher’s three biggest franchises—Far Cry, Rainbow Six Siege, and Assassin’s Creed—and give Tencent a 25% stake in the new venture. After a slight uptick, stock prices fell from €13.15 on March 27, the day of the deal, to €10.70 in just three days of trading. Since then, the prices continued to fall to what they are now.

There’s also the global uncertainty surrounding a potential recession that has the entire market falling over the last handful days.

Do you make anything of Ubisoft’s stock prices continuing to fall lately? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what popular fan-requested feature the Nintendo Switch 2 won’t have. And don’t forget to sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.
